channel.title: Runecrafting ClickObject on altar
channel.description: So this is a quick one. I have been following this guide by Arham [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=586947.0]https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=586947.0[/url] And it's all gone fine, I've made everything work with how my files are organized and fixed all the imports and such. That only issue is when actually clicking the altar it doesn't do anything because the stuff in ClickingObjects.java is now outdated, what should I add so that it now checks what alter it is and gives the rune (multiples if possible), xp, and takes away the rune ess

item.title: Runecrafting ClickObject on altar
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

You just have to add CraftRunes.checkAltar(objectID) in your object clicking packet.
If it doesn’t do anything, try putting it in object clicking 2.
If still nothing happens, you must have forgotten to add something from the tutorial.

Read full topic

item.title: Runecrafting ClickObject on altar
item.dc:creator: @RunePKn00b RunePKn00b
item.description:
@RunePKn00b wrote:

I have that, but I can’t figure out which method to put in for it.

for example for the air temple in clickobjects I have
case: ####
CraftRunes.checkAltar(####);
break

checkAltar doesn’t work, so I’m looking for the method in the link above that’ll work

Read full topic

item.title: Runecrafting ClickObject on altar
item.dc:creator: @chazion chazion
item.description:
@chazion wrote:

think about it.

if(sumthin)
do something

switch(objectid) {
case ###:
//doooo st00f
break;

case ###:
doo udder st00f
break;

default:
doo nuttin cus we shouldnt handle objects that dont need a function
return;
}

Read full topic
